column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 97 of 124”
Table: 89
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION

column1: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
column2: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
column3: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
In accordance with the recommendations of the Mary Peake
Regional Storm Water Study, this project will make system
improvements to the City's storm sewer system downstream
of the Todds Lane/Big Bethel Road intersection, which
experiences flooding during heavy rain storms. In addition, a
detention pond will be constructed for quantity and quality
improvements to the stormwater runoff.
Conduct a historical assessment and conditional survey of
the fort, buildings and structures.
Redesign Gosnold's Hope Park to better utilize the park
areas.
Renovate the existing park as the Old Hampton Community
Center is reconstructed.
Demolish existing facilities and construct a new
environmental nature center and neighborhood resource
center.
Upgrade Museum exhibits to include more interactive
materials, exhibit cases for second floor changing gallery,
installation of freight elevator and purchase existing
warehouse storage for all large objects of collection in one
secure and controlled location.
Expansion to include a floating pier with electrical and water
hook-ups capable of mooring 24 transient recreational
vessels 26 feet in length or longer. Construct permanent
restroom facilities at Mill Point Park, adjacent to the public
Piers to include a laundry room and showers.
A/E services to study each of Hampton's 20 watersheds in an
effort to improve the City's storm water system which will
reduce flooding and storm water pollution.
Installation of additional lighting from the Hampton Roads
Convention Center to the Power Plant area in response to
comments from visitors and convention goers that say they
do not feel safe walking between the two areas.
